definition: to sprout/to bud/to have a strong affection for (slang)/adorable (loanword from Japanese 萌え moe, slang describing affection for a cute character)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: With a strong desire on the bud.
sentences.chinese: 就萌动着一种强烈渴望。

sentences.english: Then the youth buds the day, the rainy night starts to become the sad reason.
sentences.chinese: 而后青春萌动的日子，雨夜开始成为忧伤的理由。

sentences.english: Beginning of spring and summer, brilliant.
In the rootstock sprout to leaf grafting as well.
sentences.chinese: 在砧木萌动到展叶期嫁接为好。

sentences.english: Chunguang everywhere are beautiful, the Qingming vegetation Germinating scene.
sentences.chinese: 到处是春光明媚，草木萌动的清明景象。

sentences.english: Deep palace adytum, do not block girl desire for love to stir.

某些东西在我内心萌动。

sentences.english: The desire to write was stirring in Martin once more.

sentences.english: General adult germinating in the spring of each year to carry out a Pruning ago.

definition: to sprout (lit. or fig.)/to bud/to germinate/germ/seed/bud
